reviews.review_msg: Shona is one of the nicest professors out there. She wants everyone to do well and gives everyone the opportunity to do so. The class is curved but if you keep up with the lecture objectives, do the weekly quizzes and go to her office hours for help with the assignment early on you will do great. The lectures can sometimes be dry but interesting!

Your ATTITUDE determines your ALTITUDE. Not with Shonas class unfortunately. The class curved and was too easy, scaling very high. You can go after participation marks and study test banks for word for word exam. Shona is passionate about the material but someone else needs to structure it so a 70% wont be a D. Working smart > attitude.

Possibly the worst professor I've encountered at SFU. The slides are just like the textbook and all she does is read the slides Felt like high school. She made the course too easy and didn't have a midterm so the class average was high, so people with 70 failed the class. She then sent a super insulting email telling us we should have worked harder

Shona seems sweet but not a good prof. Lectured about material that wouldn't be on the final. Always an issue with marks not being calculated properly for assignments and exams. She submitted the final grades, then 2 days later had to change everyone's because she didnt calculate properly. Very annoying!!

Avoid, seems easy but class is curved and average is high. 70% and below is a D lmao. 40% participation/open-book quizzes, 30% paper, 30% final. Only the learning objectives/weekly quizzes on the final. Lots to cover, lectures are boring and she covered material not on the final. Only attended for participation and left. Would not recommend :(

Shona is passionate about the work, she's not ready to teach yet. No midterm, easy class overall (untimed test bank quizzes, heavy participation marks, etc). Course curved. Class average was so high a 69 would get you a D. Shona's system assisted with this problem. Lecture lacked relative info, time spent on slides that "won't show up on the exam".

Shona is super knowledgable and extremely caring. However, she's not the best teacher, lectures are jam-packed, long, and textbook heavy. I got a B and didn't go to the last half of the lectures, super nice lady but wish the lectures were more personal as she's sUPER passionate about what she teaches

Most boring class I have ever had. Literally no need to go to class other than to get the participation marks. She's a nice person but, she definitely can't teach. She also had a quiz due after all classes ended and papers are graded pretty harshly.

There are weekly open book quizzes and two papers throughout the semester. There are participation marks, but it is a pretty chill course. She is very entertaining and knowledgeable, she is definitely worth the time.

Easy course, not a good teacher. Very very disorganized. Boring lectures. Very condescending tone toward students. Lectures often went over time for no reason, making it difficult to get to other classes. Seems like a nice person but not at all an effective teacher. Useless textbook, lectures repeated textbook content directly (boring). Avoid.

Literally show up and pass. Boring lectures, not enough content. Learn human resources and googling about clinical psychology. Only studied the quizzes and got an A. Dropped over $100 for a textbook I didn't read. Class avg was really high. You had to get 100% on the essay and final and quizzes or you will get a B+ or lower. LOL

First of all, she does not just read off the slides and the lectures are not boring. Listening to lecture on the other hand is not necessary per say, but she gives LOTS of hints for tests if you do pay attention which will save you a lot of time in the long run. The weekly quizzes are much better than a midterm, but a CUMULATIVE exam kinda sucks.

Very straightforward and interesting class. 13 quizzes, one paper, and a final exam. Final exam consisted of exactly the same questions from the take-home quizzes. 30 multiple choice questions and 6 short answers. Powerpoint slides are very detailed and useful although they sometimes too detailed. Don't hesitate to take this class, prof is amazing.

A very nice new professor from Great Britain! I love her accent. She is very passionate about the subject. The course is very well articulated. The only thing is final exam is cumulative which worth 40% of your mark. There are tons of things to memorize so make sure you study and work hard. Powerpoint slides are very informative and useful.

Very nice professor, clearly passionate about the material and very knowledgable and approachable. Lectures were a little disorganized in terms of chapter progression and identifying which slides were for which chapters. But overall solid class.

Shona is absolutely great. You can tell she really truly cares for the students and wants us to succeed. Plus, her examples and anecdotes from her work as a clinical psychologist help to clarify the material and make it much more engaging. Overall she gives off really positive vibes which make the lecture environment very welcoming.
Great prof and participation was worth 20% of the grade. So just show up and use your iclicker to get a decent mark in the class

One of the best classes I have taken at SFU. Lecture material/slides are detailed, she also made sure lectures were recorded, and gave us everything we would need to be successful in the course. She explained everything well, and gives her students opportunities to get good grades. Grading is through participation and online quizzes, no midterm.

I'd definitely take another class with Shona. She has interesting stories from her experience as a clinical psychologist, and is very approachable and friendly. Not sure on marking yet as I'm still in the course, but lots of easy marks for participating in class. This is her first time teaching but I think she's doing a great job :)
